lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of Americans think the United States should join a binding international agreement to curb growth of greenhouse gas emissions, but a slim majority of Republicans remains opposed, the poll found.

headline.main: Full Results of New York Times/CBS News Poll on the Environment

snippet: Two-thirds of Americans think the United States should join a binding international agreement to curb growth of greenhouse gas emissions, but a slim majority of Republicans remains opposed, the poll found.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
